intro: Leptospermum fabricia, commonly known as the slender tea tree, is a shrub native to Australia. It belongs to the Myrtaceae family and is characterized by its small, narrow leaves and clusters of white or pale pink flowers. The plant produces small, woody fruits that contain seeds. It typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is adapted to dry, coastal environments. Leptospermum fabricia is often used in coastal landscaping due to its hardiness and ornamental value.
